TEXT.citation: Indigenous Languages Research and Development Foundation. (2020). 族語E樂園. https://web.klokah.tw/

S.FORM: yani ku inu’/ yani ku aynu’
glu mu/ baays mu/ kanayril mu/ mamaliku mu
glu mu/ baays mu/ mamaliku mu

S.TRANSL: 哥哥、姊姊(通稱)；對比自己年長者之尊稱
弟弟、妹妹(通稱)；對比自己年少之稱呼
伯父；叔叔；舅舅；姑丈(通稱)
伯母；嬸嬸；舅母；姑姑(通稱)

S.FORM: raqni’ na kahuneq/ raqni’ na kahuy
taqiyng na kahuneq/ taqiyng na kahuy
batah na kahuneq/batah na kahuneq kahuy
aimag cu raramat/ paptupiyux cu raramat

S.TRANSL: the thing stuck between the teeth

S.FORM: papawng cu pinateq/ papawng cu pinatas
puqing na ragiyax/ yahu’ na ragiyax
S.TRANSL: at the foot of the mountain

S.FORM: ciax na Utux/ taptap na Utux
siyag na baru’/ aping na baru’
hakri’ na Utux/ hakaw na Utux
mahantan a kaal la/ ini’ saluwi a kaal la
latanux na imuwag/ suug na imuwag/ lata’ na imu/ suug na imu
guma cu ki’man/ gumba cu ki’man
Gaga’ na tatubunan cu Utux na nanabakis

S.TRANSL: witchcarft appliance (witch doctor use it for treatment)

S.FORM: gagalgan cu kulu’/ autuan cu kulu’
kumayhu na qaba’/ kumayi’ na qaba’
qumali’ cu qali’ na kahuneq/ qumali’ cu qali’ na kahuy
S.TRANSL: peeling the bark of a tree

S.FORM: mateq cu qalimu’/ matas cu qalimu’

S.TRANSL: calling (e.g. calling before feeding the chickens)

S.FORM: mapapugagayay ta’ la/ mapugagayay ta’ la/ masasugagayay ta’ la/ masugagayay ta’ la

S.TRANSL: dry (e.g., drying clothes in the sun)
pack up (imperatives, as in pack up)
fishing for fish and shrimp by cage
lift off (as in lift off the lid).
burn (as in burning the hair of prey)

S.FORM: iqaat lupung na Itaal ku usalan
S.TRANSL: marry to a non-ethnic clan member
未熟的(如這塊肉是生的)
undercooked (if this piece of meat is raw)
脆弱(如這根鐵絲易斷裂)
fragile (e.g. this wire is prone to breakage)
in the process of (doing something or happening)
